description: '''Ulpiano Díaz''' (1900–1990) was a Cuban [[timbalero]]. He is considered an innovator of the timbales, being the first to add a small cowbell to the setup, and popularizing the [[abanico (music)|abanico]]. He started his career playing güiro in Félix González's [[orquesta típica]], and rose to prominence as the timbales player of three important [[Charanga (Cuba)|charangas]]: Orquesta de Tata Alfonso, [[Arcaño y sus Maravillas]] and [[José Fajardo (musician)|Fajardo y sus Estrellas]].
